item.title: [DELTA]Cook fish contiunesly on fires
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

Heres the code i got

if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 317) { deleteItem(317, 1); addItem(315, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(120, playerCooking); sM("You cook the shrimps."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 327 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 4) { deleteItem(327, 1); addItem(325, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(140, playerCooking); sM("You cook the sardine."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 345 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 9) { deleteItem(345, 1); addItem(347, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(160, playerCooking); sM("You cook the herring."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 321 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 14) { deleteItem(321, 1); addItem(319, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(200, playerCooking); sM("You cook the anchovies."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 335 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 19) { deleteItem(335, 1); addItem(333, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(250, playerCooking); sM("You cook the trout."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 349 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 24) { deleteItem(349, 1); addItem(351, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(300, playerCooking); sM("You cook the pike."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 331 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 29) { deleteItem(331, 1); addItem(329, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(400, playerCooking); sM("You cook the salmon."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 359 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 34) { deleteItem(359, 1); addItem(361, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(450, playerCooking); sM("You cook the tuna."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 377 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 39) { deleteItem(377, 1); addItem(379, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(500, playerCooking); sM("You cook the lobster."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 371 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 49) { deleteItem(371, 1); addItem(373, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(1000, playerCooking); sM("You cook the swordfish."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 383 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 60) { deleteItem(383, 1); addItem(385, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(1800, playerCooking); sM("You cook the shark."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 395 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 78) { deleteItem(395, 1); addItem(397, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(24500, playerCooking); sM("You cook the sea turtle."); setAnimation(883); } if (UsedOnObjectID == 2732 && ItemID == 389 && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 80) { deleteItem(389, 1); addItem(391, 1); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); addSkillXP(2950, playerCooking); sM("You cook the manta ray."); setAnimation(883); }

I want to make it were it keeps cooking until all raw fish are done
for example I want to cook all manta rays in my inventory without keep having to click on them to the fires
